com.cyc.kb.client

Class SentenceImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cyc.kb.client.KBObjectImpl
      • com.cyc.kb.client.SentenceImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    KBObject, Sentence
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    QuantifiedRestrictedVariable, RestrictedVariable

    public class SentenceImpl
extends KBObjectImpl
implements Sentence
    A Sentence object is a Java representation of a syntactically well-formed #$CycLSentence. Denotational terms (including terms formed by functions) are not sentences, but can be included as elements of sentences. A syntactically well-formed Sentence consists of a Relation followed by any number of additional terms, which could be denotational terms or additional sentences. A sentence need not obey the arity restrictions of the top-level Relation in order to be syntactically well-formed. In other words, the only restriction that must be obeyed to construct a sentence is that there must be a relation in the 0th position. Unlike most of the objects in the KB API which correspond directly to an object on the Cyc server, sentences are merely combinations of objects that exist on the server, but the combination itself need not correspond to a server-side object. They can, however, still be used and understood by the server, and are used extensively to perform queries or make assertions.
    Since:
    1.0

             throws KBTypeException,
                    CreateException
        Return a new Sentence based on the existing CycFormulaSentence cycObject.
        Parameters:
        cycObject - the source CycObject for the Sentence. The constructor verifies that the CycObject is a #$CycLSentence
        Throws:
        KBTypeException - is thrown in cycObject is not an instance of CycFormulaSentence
        CreateException

      • SentenceImpl

        public SentenceImpl(Relation pred,
            Object... args)
             throws KBTypeException,
                    CreateException
        Builds a sentence based on pred and other args. Note that args should be KBObjects, Strings, Numbers, or Dates. This constructor also handles Lists and Sets (and Lists of Lits or Sets of Lists, etc.) of those supported objects.
        Parameters:
        pred - the first argument of the formula
        args - the other arguments of the formula in the order they appear in the list
        Throws:
        KBTypeException - is thrown if the built cycObject is not a instance of CycFormulaSentence. This should never happen.
        CreateException

      • SentenceImpl

        public SentenceImpl(Object... args)
             throws KBTypeException,
                    CreateException
        Builds an arbitrary sentence based on the args provided. Note that args should either be KBObjects or Java classes, String, Number or Date. This constructor also handles java.util.List and java.util.Set of other supported KB API or Java objects. It even supports, List of List etc.
        Parameters:
        args - the arguments of the formula in order
        Throws:
        KBTypeException - never thrown
        CreateException

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        KBApiException - if the Sentence represented by sentStr could not be parsed.

        Parameters:

      • isAssertible

        public boolean isAssertible(Context ctx)
        Description copied from interface: Sentence
        Checks if a given sentence meets the constraints necessary to be assertible in ctx. In particular, returns true if the arguments of the sentence are compatible with the argument constraints of the operator (i.e. could be made to actually meet the constraints without removing any existing assertions). For sentences with predicate operators, the arguments must also be compatible with all relevant interArg* constraints. In some cases, additional requirements are imposed (e.g. the constraints must actually be known to be met, not just not be known to be incompatible). For an explanation of why a particular sentence is not assertible, check Sentence.notAssertibleExplanation(com.cyc.kb.Context)
        Specified by:
        isAssertible in interface Sentence
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context where semantic constraints are checked
        Returns:
        if the sentence is compatible with all relevant syntactic and semantic constraints, and is therefore assertible.

      • notAssertibleExplanation

        public String notAssertibleExplanation(Context ctx)
        Description copied from interface: Sentence
        Return an explanation of why the sentence is not assertible. Note that this reason may not be exhaustive; once the problems mentioned in the reason are fixed, additional calls to this method may turn up additional problems.
        Specified by:
        notAssertibleExplanation in interface Sentence
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context where semantic constraints are checked
        Returns:
        a detailed explanation of why a sentence is not assertible. Returns null if it encounters an internal error.

      • replaceTerms

        public Sentence replaceTerms(List<Object> from,
                    List<Object> to)
                      throws KBTypeException,
                             CreateException
        Description copied from interface: Sentence
        For each element of from replace it with the element of to that's at the same index. This does not modify the original SentenceImpl, but instead returns a new sentence.
        Specified by:
        replaceTerms in interface Sentence
        Parameters:

        to - a list of objects that will be in the new modified sentence
